feed.title: Early Buzz: Carrie Bradshaw, Madonna, Lindsay Lohan and More
feed.subtitle: AnnaSophia Robb will star as Carrie Bradshaw in upcoming Sex and the City prequel series The Carrie Diaries.

content.div:
The new Carrie Bradshaw is...this kid! AnnaSophia Robb (The Bridge to Terabithia) will star as mini Sarah Jessica Parker in The CW's upcoming Sex and the City prequel series, The Carrie Diaries.

--

In her 50s, Madonna's still a "Girl Gone Wild." Listen to the latest song off her upcoming album, MDNA.

--

Expect Whitney Houston's final film, Sparkle, to shine on the big screen sooner than expected. According to reports, makers of the movie are rushing to finish it.

--

Lindsay Lohan will be doing a "no holds barred" interview with The Today Show's Matt Lauer. Finally! The world will get the scoop on all of the fascinating things she hasn't been doing.

--

Taylor Swift found a date for the Academy of Country Music Awards. She'll be taking an 18-year-old fan, Kevin McGuire, to the show. (McGuire, who has leukemia, started a Facebook campaign to meet Swift.)

--

Gerard Butler managed to get out of rehab long enough to do the Oscar party circuit.

--

Twilight's Robert Pattinson and Kristen Stewart were spotted doing couple-y things during Oscar weekend, because they're a couple.

--

Nicole Richie says her four-year-old daughter, Harlow, has yet to realize she's D-list famous (so we've hopefully got a good 10 years before the kid pitches The Simple Life 2.0).

--

In other celebrity-baby news, Gwyneth Paltrow says that Beyonce and Jay-Z's daughter Blue Ivy Carter is "destined for stardom." She apparently hasn't noticed that the kid's already famous. (For example, she's already being hounded by the paps.)

--

Apparently Katy Perry is Interview magazine's latest cover girl, though you'd hardly be able to tell from the photo.

--

And on the topic of Ms. California Gurl, it seems Perry's been playing loose with her Teenage Dream money. During Elton John's post-Oscar party, Perry dropped $50,000 in a charity auction -- for cooking lessons.

--

This one's not just another Chuck Norris joke: a bridge connecting Slovakia to Austria could be named after the Walker, Texas Ranger star.

--

Selena Gomez, 19, got a tattoo. It's a music note and it's on her wrist.

--

Dunder-Mifflin is hiring. James Spader is leaving The Office after one season.

--

Yet another Sherlock Holmes series is on the way, but this one will feature Lucy Liu as Watson.

--

And finally, even Angelina Jolie's dad thinks her "leg" is hilarious.

--

Check back to Dose.ca throughout the day for your entertainment fix.
